name: West Asian Music
description: Music of West Asia, a region covering most of what is commonly known as the Middle East but not extending into North Africa.

children.name: Azerbaijani Music
children.description: Music of the Azerbaijani people, who inhabit the modern day country of Azerbaijan, along with a significant population in the neighboring country of Iran.

children.name: Caucasian Music
children.description: Music of the region of the Caucasus, a mountainous region bordered by Russia to the north and Turkey/Iran to the south, with the Black and Caspian seas to its sides.

children.name: Gilaki Music
children.description: Music of the Gilak people of northern Iran.

children.name: Iraqi Maqam
children.description: Highly structured but semi-improvised and rhythmically complex compositions built around set structures which consist of specific maqam modes.

children.name: Khaliji Music
children.description: Musical traditions of Eastern Arabia and the Persian Gulf region, roughly covering the Arabic-speaking people of the modern countries of the United Arab Emirates, Bahrain, Kuwait, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Oman, Iraq, and Iran.

children.name: Kurdish Music
children.description: Traditional music of the Kurds, a distinct ethnic group inhabiting the region of Kurdistan, characterized by its mountainous terrain spanning southeastern Turkey, northern Iraq, northwestern Iran, and northeastern Syria.

children.name: Levantine Arabic Music
children.description: The musical traditions of the Levantine Arabs, roughly covering the Arabic people of the modern countries of Israel, Jordan, Lebanon, Palestine, and Syria.

children.name: Maftirim
children.description: Paraliturgical songs of Sephardi Jews who lived in Ottoman Empire.

children.name: Mesopotamian Music
children.description: Music of Mesopotamia, a historical region situated in West Asia within the Tigrisâ€“Euphrates river system, comprises the heritage of Sumerians and Akkadians.

children.name: Muzika mizrahit
children.description: Middle Eastern-flavored Israeli popular music, usually performed by Mizrahi Jews, and combining aspects of the music of the North African, Middle Eastern, and Central Asian countries from which they descended.

children.name: Turkish Music
children.description: Traditions developed by the Turkish people.

children.name: West Asian Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of West Asia, a region that covers much of what is commonly known in English as the Middle East (alternatively Southwestern Asia), includes the distinct but interconnected traditions of numerous ethnic groups.
